name: surface
description:
The surface command analyzes surface type information for roads and paths. Surface categories:

- Paved: asphalt, concrete, paving stones, cobblestone
- Unpaved: gravel, dirt, earth, grass, sand
- Special: rubber, tartan, artificial turf, clay

Useful for cycling/walking route planning and infrastructure analysis.

options.-s, --surface: Filter by surface type (asphalt, gravel, etc.)
options.-c, --category: Filter by category: paved, unpaved, special
options.-f, --format: Output format: geojson, json, csv (default: geojson)
options.--unknown-only: Show only ways without surface info

output:
Surface analysis showing:
- surface: Surface type
- smoothness: Surface quality
- tracktype: Track grade (for tracks)
- highway: Road type
- length_m: Segment length

Statistics include coverage percentages by surface type and highway.
examples: osmfast surface city.osm --surface asphalt --highway path -o paved_paths.geojson
